name: Great Hall Terk Greets 1: Initial Encounter

nodes.text: You should be in class.

nodes.message: Only interested in the "Else" case, so no code here.
Shawn had to ask! Now he must get a uniform.

nodes.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Terk. The Disbarred Bards class is over for the day and I wanted to make sure I know my way around the school. I wouldn't want to get lost on my way to school events, after all.
Hmph. The class is out already? Then you are most likely expected to study your lessons in the afternoon rather than dillydallying around the school.
Because you are new here, I'll overlook your slacking off for today. The Dining Room is further down this hall and will be open at six for supper.
Class is over for the day, sir. I'm exploring the school right now so that I learn my way around. After all, I wouldn't want to be late for anything.
Hmph. The class is out already? Then you are most likely expected to study your lessons in the afternoon rather than dillydallying around the school.
Because you are new here, I'll overlook your slacking off for today. The Dining Room is further down this hall and will be open at six for supper.
I was told by Master von Urwald that I needed to buy a thieves' toolkit kit, so I thought I'd just head back to Caligari to find one.
A thieves' toolkit? It is outrageous that such an illegal activity be taught at this school!
As for you, young man, you are on probation. You are not to leave the castle. Any purchases you need can be made at the School Store.
I can't leave the castle? For how long?
You must stay inside this castle until you are expelled for poor behavior, fail your Disbarred Bards class, or in the unlikely event that you make it to the end of the semester.
So, is there some rule that says I can't walk around the school after my class is over? Is this area off-limits for me or something?
Watch your tone, young man. If your class is over, then you are expected to study your lessons. The Practice Room is downstairs by your classroom.
The Library is through the door over there to the courtyard. The door to the Dining Hall is further down this corridor, and the door to the stairs down to the school store is around the corner.
Use your time wisely, Mr. O'Conner. Don't waste it.
So are you the guy in charge of this school?
While the Headmaster may have founded the school, I am the person in charge of making certain that all students follow the rules and properly respect authority.
If I were in charge of this school, there would be no "Disbarred Bards" class, nor would the likes of you be allowed in this school.
What's the point of this school?
This university gives students the proper tools and education to do heroic things and make the world a better place.
What heroism has to do with you, I do not know. The Headmaster is in grave error if he believes that you or your classmates will become anything other than criminals.
I'm told that I need to buy something from the School Store.
A likely excuse. The store is downstairs from here. Go to the end of the corridor, turn right, and through the door.
The shopkeeper is another example of how ill-managed this university is. Why that overgrown rodent is tolerated here, I have no idea.

options.text: Ask How You Can Better Fit In at the School

nodes.message: Only show this if Shawn is not already wearing the school uniform.

nodes.text: Tell me, sir, what I can do to better fit in around here? I'd like to make a good impression.
Hmph. If you want to try to make something of yourself - get yourself a school uniform from the store and wear it during school hours. At least that way, you won't look like a ragamuffin tramp.

nodes.name: School Uniform
nodes.description: Great. Mr. Terk expects me to buy a school uniform. I suppose he wants me to wear it, too. I guess I should learn to avoid Terk whenever possible.

nodes.text: That's clearly a fine suggestion. I'll buy one as soon as I can.
See that you do. I expect you to be wearing it the next time I see you during school hours.
I didn't realize that there even was a school uniform. I'll look into it.
At the moment, you look like a total disgrace to this school. You need to dress up or get out.
Why isn't everyone here wearing an Official Hero University Uniform? It sounds like the sort of order you would enforce.
I've made that suggestion several times to the Headmaster. Students should look like they belong in a school for higher learning rather than the streets of Caligari.
But Gerhard insists that students should be allowed to dress as they see fit. Bah! This is a university! Students need to learn to follow orders and do as they are told - not think for themselves.
Yes, clearly you should lead the students to knowledge, but you can't let them think.
After all, they may think that wearing school uniforms is a stupid waste of money.
Insolence will not be tolerated! I'm giving you five demerits. Watch your tongue from now on.
And get yourself a school uniform or you'll get demerits every time I see you out of it!
I'll see you later, sir.
I want to see you as little as possible, Conner. Stay out of trouble and away from me. Curfew is at 10pm. If I catch you walking around the halls after that, you will receive demerits.
We shall see how quickly you earn 100 demerits so that I can say farewell to you for good.
